intro: Spiraea ulmifolia var. phyllantha, commonly known as the silver-leaf weeping spirea, is a deciduous shrub native to the mountainous regions of central and eastern Europe. It is characterized by its dense, cascading clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in early summer. The leaves are elliptical, with a silvery-white underside, giving the plant its distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soil and full to partial sun, making it a popular choice for garden borders and hedges. This variety is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
